problems.title: Longest Palindromic Subsequence
problems.description:
Problem Statement

Given a string S, find the length of the Longest Palindromic Subsequence (LPS).

A palindrome reads the same forwards and backwards.
A subsequence doesn't need to be contiguous.

Key Insight: LPS of S = LCS of S and reverse(S).

Alternatively, use 2D DP directly on the string.

DP State: dp[i][j] = length of LPS in substring S[i..j].
problems.examples:
Sample Input
bbbab

Sample Output
4

Explanation:
The longest palindromic subsequence is "bbbb" with length 4.
problems.constraints:
1 <= |S| <= 1000
String contains only lowercase English letters.
hintsList: Reverse the string and find LCS between original and reversed. LCS length = LPS length.
Alternative: dp[i][j] based on s[i..j]. If s[i]==s[j]: dp[i][j] = dp[i+1][j-1] + 2. Else: max(dp[i+1][j], dp[i][j-1]).
